Name: African Violet (Saintpaulia ionantha)
Desc: A compact flowering plant with vibrant blooms and fuzzy leaves. It thrives in indoor environments with moderate light. Regular watering and humidity help maintain its beauty.
Use: Used for decorative purposes, enhancing indoor aesthetics, and adding a touch of nature to homes.

Name: Aloe Vera
Desc: A succulent plant with thick, fleshy leaves filled with a soothing gel. It is easy to maintain and can grow both indoors and outdoors. It requires minimal watering and thrives in warm climates.
Use: Used in skincare, for treating burns, digestive health, and minor wound healing.

Name: Anthurium (Anthurium andraeanum)
Desc: A tropical plant known for its glossy green leaves and vibrant, heart-shaped flowers. It prefers humid conditions and indirect sunlight. Regular misting keeps the foliage healthy.
Use: Used as a decorative plant, for air purification, and adding color to indoor spaces.

Name: Areca Palm (Dypsis lutescens)
Desc: A popular indoor palm with feathery, arching fronds. It helps in purifying air and adds a tropical feel to interiors. It requires bright, indirect sunlight and regular watering.
Use: Used for improving indoor air quality, ornamental decoration, and enhancing interior aesthetics.

Name: Asparagus Fern (Asparagus setaceus)
Desc: A delicate, feathery plant that adds texture and greenery to indoor spaces. It thrives in indirect light and requires moderate watering. Though not a true fern, it is popular in decorative arrangements.
Use: Used for ornamental purposes, in hanging baskets, and as a houseplant.

Name: Begonia (Begonia spp.)
Desc: A versatile plant with vibrant flowers and striking foliage. It thrives in partial shade and well-draining soil. It is commonly grown in gardens and indoors as a decorative plant.
Use: Used for ornamental gardening, landscaping, and indoor decoration.

Name: Bird of Paradise (Strelitzia reginae)
Desc: A striking tropical plant with orange and blue flowers resembling a bird in flight. It requires bright light and warm conditions to thrive. It is a symbol of paradise and exotic beauty.
Use: Used in landscaping, as a statement indoor plant, and for adding a tropical touch to gardens.
